result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin J Biersteker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond on file.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Credit for 8 days served, if revoked.

JOC - "Return to Sender Not Deliverable as Addressed Unable to Forward"  
Some hand wrote "Not at this address Released 12/15 "

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  117 days sentence credit stipulated to.  Parties have read the revocation summary.  No changes.  State recommended 6 months jail.  Attorney Poss agrees.  Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  9 months jail.  Credit for 117 days.  May serve in Waukesha County.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 01-27-2016 03:30 pm
And Revocation Summary  (copies sent to DA & Judge)

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Defendant plead no contest to count 1.  Joint recommendation for probation.  Elements reviewed by the court with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights with the defendant.  Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.   Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the charge.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty of count 1.   Joint recommendation for 2 years probation.  AODA.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  s/m employment.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Attorney Sebion says the defendant has 8 days credit.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 2 years probation.  AODA and recommended treatment.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Seek and maintain employment.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. 8 days credit if revoked.  CC & DNA surcharge.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Adjourn plea/sentencing to 9/21/15 at 1:30 pm

Defendant appeared with counsel SPD Carly Sebion.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defense waived reading of complaint and filed a Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing form.  Court reviewed the form and his right to a preliminary hearing with the defendant.  Finds he knowingly and intelligently waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Bound over for trial.  State filed an Information.  Defense waived reading of the Information and proceeded to arraignment by entering  a not guilty plea.  Court set a pretrial for 7-1-15 and a status conference on 7-20-15 at 3:00.  Bond continued.
